law.catch_line: Public road districts authorized in counties.
law.text: Public road districts may be established in counties for the purpose of providing the general public and persons residing upon or owning property adjacent to such roads with all-weather roads, appropriate drainage of said roads and sidewalks on either or both sides of said roads with reasonable maintenance during the existence of the road district.
law.history: Amended 2014 Ky. Acts ch. 92, sec. 264, effective January 1, 2015. -- Amended 1980 Ky. Acts ch. 56, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1980. -- Amended 1968 Ky. Acts ch. 55, sec. 1. -- Amended 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 11, sec. 1. -- Created 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 65, sec. 1.
